title: Dec 02, 2015
content: Dr. David Thurston (VP of Atkins) gave an informative presentation on railroad capacity, train control systems and civil designs. Thanks, Dr. Thurston!

title: Nov 27, 2015
content: Congratulations to Xiaoxi Ma (former group member) on accepting a data scientist position at Optimal Strategix Group. Xiaoxi has participated in geospatial risk analysis of railroad accidents in the summer of 2015 and recently received her M.S. in Statistics from Rutgers University. Best luck on your new position, Xiaoxi!

title: Nov 23, 2015
content: Ms. Ingrid Schultze (Rutgers alumna), a successful serial entrepreneur specialized in applied operations research, shared her experience with students and suggested how to stand out in the career. Thanks very much, Ingrid!

title: Nov 05, 2015
content: Mr. Anthony Murray from the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA) gave an informative presentation regarding hazmat transportation regulations

title: Oct 14, 2015
content: The group had its first academic writing training workshop. Dr. David Jones, a professional English editor, was invited to give a lecture on how to improve writing skills.

title: Oct 13, 2015
content: Kang Zhou's paper entitled "Risk-based ship collision-avoidance maneuvers under bunker consumption optimization" was accepted into the Proceedings of the Annual Meeting of Transportation Research Board. He will present this work at D.C. in 2016. Congratulations, Kang!

title: Sep 29, 2015
content: Six abstracts have been accepted to the Joint Rail Conference in South Carolina in 2016. The studies cover train accident risk analysis and infrastructure management. Can, Tal, Jiabo, Ling, Yanlei, Yubo are eligible for applying for a travel scholarship

title: Sep 20, 2015
content: Can Hu submitted a final report to the Railway Applications Section (RAS) of the Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences (INFORMS) for a competition on railroad data analytics. His research, entitled "Predicting Track Geometry Degradation using Data Mining Techniques" addresses data-driven railroad infrastructure management. Good luck, Can!

title: Aug 05, 2015
content: Congratualtions to Can Hu for receiving a NSF travel award to present his railroad data analytics research in Seattle. Good job, Can!
